lead_paragraph: Top-ranked Roger Federer beat the qualifier Julien Benneteau, 6-3, 6-3, last night at the Western & Southern Financial Group Masters in Mason, Ohio, in a match devoid of surprises. Earlier, Rafael Nadal, the No. 2 player in the world, and Novak Djokovic were ousted from the tournament. Nadal — his right knee wrapped and his left wrist aching — retired in the second set of his match against Juan Mónaco. Fourth-seeded Djokovic lost to Carlos Moyá, 6-4, 6-1.
